title: Figma Launches AI-Powered Erase, Isolate, and Expand Tools for Seamless In-App Image Editing

paragraphs.content: Figma announced three new AI-powered image editing tools—**Erase object**, **Isolate object**, and **Expand image**—on December 10, 2025, enabling designers to perform precise edits directly within the platform without exporting to external software. These tools integrate into a revamped unified toolbar alongside features like Remove background and Crop, addressing common workflows such as object removal, subject isolation, and background extension. Initially available in Figma Design and Figma Draw for users on Professional, Organization, and Enterprise plans with AI enabled, the update emphasizes prompt-free, granular control powered by advanced AI models.

paragraphs.content: The **Erase object** tool uses an upgraded lasso selector to delete unwanted elements while preserving surrounding details like lighting, shadows, and backgrounds. **Isolate object** allows users to separate subjects for repositioning or adjustments such as color, blur, desaturation, or focus tweaks, maintaining image consistency. **Expand image** intelligently fills extended areas to adapt assets to new aspect ratios, like converting square product shots to landscape banners for web or social media. This consolidation reduces platform-switching, streamlining tasks for designers, marketers, and product teams.

sections.title: Unified Toolbar Streamlines Precision Editing Workflows

paragraphs.content: Figma's new toolbar consolidates image editing options, giving prominent placement to high-usage features like Remove background for quick access to selections, annotations, and color changes. The tools eliminate the need for text prompts, offering lasso-based control superior to generative models for editing tasks. Designers can now refine visuals on-canvas, closing loops on time-consuming processes like optimizing for device sizes or marketing materials.

Recent ecosystem updates, including AI credit tracking for admins, complement these advancements amid over 150 features released in 2025.

sections.title: Industry Hails Efficiency Gains Amid Competitive Catch-Up

paragraphs.content: Content creators praise the tools for enabling in-house edits, reducing design team pings and accelerating test variations for campaigns. Tech analysts note Figma matching long-standing Adobe and Canva capabilities in object removal, positioning it as a full-stack design hub. The launch aligns with Adobe's similar ChatGPT integrations, where Figma partnered in October 2025, though cross-tool details remain unclear.

Experts view the update as assistive AI that prioritizes user control over disruptive generation, fostering faster cross-functional reviews. Broader adoption in 2026 could extend benefits to prototyping and additional products. As of early 2026, sources confirm sustained workflow improvements without major follow-ups.
